name: Warface
description: Warface is a free-to-play MMO first person shooter from the creators of Far Cry and Crysis. It is packed with cooperative and competitive action, a range of game modes and a wealth of weapons for you to get your hands on.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 Processor: Intel/AMD Dual-Core 2.0 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8600 GT 256MB / AMD ATI Radeon X1950 256MB DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 15 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 Processor: Intel Core2Duo E6-series / Athlon64 X2 6400+ Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 9600GT 512MB / AMD Radeon HD 4830 512MB DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 15 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers

reviews.review_text: The Africa update took all of my money and left me with no food. I geuss it's pretty realistic?

Pros:  -Confortable game speed, coming with swift sliding -Detailed graphic and good sound effect -Well-balanced weaponry... uh, at least no Pay2Win thingy -MINE KILL FTW (I love being the engineer so much.) -Free to play, easy to pick  Cons: -Awful chat... just awful... -Too high cost for every single equip -Nonfunctional rank system (After rank 13 we have to join matches with RANK 80 BEASTS. It would be great if we have regulated matches based on K/D ratio or something.) -No Asian server (I truly have a strong wish that we have JPN server for this good game.)  I mainly play PvP and some say it's nothing but camping and spawnkilling. Still, sometimes we have good, intense matches. Though this game has quite a few flaws to fix, I believe Warface is one of the best free to play FPS on Steam.

This game is not P2W. If you've played Combat Arms this game is piece of cake.   Pros - Low system requirements. - Good aim system. (If you are aiming you don't miss.) - Cheap stuff. (You can unlock best armor in 20 games)  Cons - Engineers kill you everytime... Everywhere... THEY ARE EVERYWHERE! THEIR MINES MAKES ME CRAZY! - You need good teammates if you want to survive PvE or Operations.  - Bad matchmaking system over 13 lvl. You can matchup with 80 lvl players and they beat the crap out of you.  - There is plenty of bad players who has %50 headshoot rate... Luck is overloaded.  Download it. If you ever gonna pay. Pay for VIP. Good luck, have fun.
'Best Uninstalling Simulator Ever !'- IGN

Warface, the first experience of Crytek in the free-to-play field, is a very nice competitive online FPS, with a lot of well-known game modes and fast gameplay. The visuals are pure Crytek quality, and even if it’s not an original game, it surely deserves a deep look. Problems: Server Crashing. 9/10

Positive: I Downloaded this game just for coop playing with a fev of my mate as it look nice to my and im was sure i can enjoy this with my friends , and in a fev round's i totally enjoyed it , now fired up to join a PvP match just to see how's going as i have thinked this is definately a pay to win game , well , it's not , i played in a looby with high lvl gamer's mixed up with a fe beginers , and i finished second in my Team with 33 Kills and 16 Dead fails even if my team have high lvl players.  I have used only the deafult weapon's ( stock ) and i was still able to fight without any problems agains the high lvl player with huge equipment = NOT A PAY TO WIN GAME = POSITIVE SUPRISE FOR ME  Negative: The only problem so far what actually is really boring is this litle Micro stuttering 'lag' by moving the mouse around the map , this can easily makes you to miss the head of the enemy by a fail of the game not becouse your aim bad = this is not enjoyable.  ( This must be fixed )  and what i not like is that only a fev guns/equipments etc etc you can buy by playing the game and get $ to buy them , most of them you can only buy with reall money , but this is normall for a free to play game , so far i can kill them i can live with that  Didn't played alot , just started but so far i shoot 8/10 for this game MP & Coop , but coop is much more funn for me!

it's amazing to play alittle hard to learn but it's one of the best free to play games i ever played it's fair and not a lot of cheaters in the game and its not pay to win and the best thing is that it's free to play so why not give it a try

Alright soo most people say that this game is pay to win or you have to grind the game to get stuff on my opinion thats not true i have 72 hours on the game and i never had to grind the game sure maybe this day i wont have mucht money to buy what i whant but maybe the next day i will .  Warface is a co-op game and also pvp I has several game modes for pvp Team deathmacht , storm , Plant the bomb , Capture , and you get daily co-op missions and if you complete thos missions you get crowns now i wont get to mucht detail about the crowns but basically if you complete a mission you will get a kill points score and the time that you got on that mission and depending how well your team did you get different reward.  Co-op is a great part of the game thats what i mostly play on this game its great with friends and then you got thos interactions with players that you never see on other games even battlefield for example sliding now sliding can sometimes get annoying because its hard to hit them sometimes but its also fun and then you got the climbing on this theres certain areas you can achive by you and friend helping each other up ther you can decide just to boost your friend and stay down ther or you can both go up .  Finaly you got special operations i havent tried yet i only did cyber horde and its awsome really hope to see more content for that but other special operations are Tower raid and Operation: Cold peak .  But no game is perfect sometimes you get small lag issues or it takes some time to load the game or the round and then you will hear the usual people complaning about shotguns ( shotguns are not op dont worry ) and camping and yada .  But overrall i really love this game its great i ain´t mucht of a pvp i mostly play about 4 to 5 rounds of pvp then like the 6 co-op missions.  About hackers its not full of hacker Crytec got the fairfight system now the game is more clean . Overall i give this game about an 9/10 i really recomend play this game.

It's fun and free. Co-Op or Competitive Multiplayer. Either way, this is a shooter worthy of being head-to-head with either the Call of Duty or Battlefield franchises. The only negatives would be if you do not pay for better weapons then you will most certainly grind long hard hard for them, and it's not real popular or as popular as I personally think it should and could be so finding a full lobby (especially in-between new and pro players) is hard outside peak hours. Other than that the whole game is mind-blowingly awesome for a F2P FPS. Fun, fast-paced, and addictive. Crytek does NOT disappoint.

Whether you like set missions or team deathmatch, this is the game for you.

This is actually a fun game in many ways. The main con is the fact that a large amount of items that can be bought are quite expensive for what they are. Even though I agree that Warface has pros and cons, people who say that 'the best part was uninstalling the game' are far too biased and the game isn't actually Pay-to-win.

This game isn't bad or a free to play, I don't know why everyone thinks it is. You can't compare this to ARMA 3, or Counterstrike, or CoD because two of those are $60 games. This however, is free.  The cash shop is similar to other free to play games, you get cash semi-slowly (to urge you to buy the other cash) to buy and maintain equipment, but if you are really good or just play a lot you can get the best gear using crowns a currency obtained through co-op play, it only lasts a short while (I think seven days or so) but it's much better than anything else, in turn making it easier to get even more crowns. Then there are special weapons that are better than the basic versions that only last for a week or so, but they are better and some are event themed, The world cup tournaments, Christmass, and other holidays don't exactly last forever you know. They basic guns are permanent.  The (co-op) maps are narrow to kind of guide the player through what is next as opposed to having them run in circle saying where am I going. I do not play multiplayer yet so I don't know anything about that, but the co-op is fun and later it is challenging, but if you can't do the skilled level you can go back to the regular and get more stuff then later get good enough to do skilled.  The games graphics actually look good. I don't know why some say they are bad, again it's free to play I guess nobody like realm of the mad god because if these grapics are bad I feel bad for that games reviews. Yes they do saymade with cryteks cry enginebut it looks good for a free to play, heck it looks good for a pay game even, but hey if they are bad you can go and desing better graphics and give the developers that. So have fun with that. The game looks like it's from July 1, 2014.  Yes the game is still in beta at the time I'm making this, and granted 'its been in beta for one year now and the same problems exist now as they did back then' That doesn't mean they cant be fixed. They may not be fixed, but they can be. Plus there is the fact that there aren't many 'bad' things about the game. The only bad things I can think of is that there is a special tab with nothing ever in it, that I've found yet, There aren't a ton of guns there a okay amount but I want more, and the repair system, I feel like that will annoy me. Other than those though it's a good game, and I'd recommend it.

7.2/10 Now that I dig in into more of the game itself, I'm starting to like it even though there are some aspects of the game I despise. Let's talk about the juicy parts about the game and why it's so interesting to play while it's a free-to-play game.  Positive Things: - Free To Play - Safe Zone (Practice Place) - Co-Op (Missions) - Attachments from Crysis - Call of Duty Aspects - Easy to find players to play with  Negative Things: - Bad Community in Versus Mode - Pay to Win on some things - Limited Days Systems on Guns - Sometimes stuck against playing with hardcore players  Though it's my opinion of course, I'd recommend this game. It's a mixed of Crysis and Call of Duty. Made by Farcry and Crysis both together. The game has some negative aspects, but there's always a positive part that hooks you into this game. My reason to keep on playing is Co-Op; great missions and unlockables.

Warface is a free to play (microtransaction) game with co-op and many online 'versus' gamemodes. My friends and I love this game a lot. It's very fun and plays very well. There are 3 different types of games to play and I know at least two are fun. (versus and co-op) There are some 'pay to win' apects like buying guns for real money, but it's not too big of a deal.   COMPLAINTS:  -Segregation of players by rank. For example: When one of my friends played more than us, he was separated into the 'pro' category for the versus mode. Now me and my other friend have to play by ourselves, alone, until we reach a high enough rank to play with my friend. -Hacking galore. Aim bots. They'll suddenly jerk to a new direction and land heashot on my whole team. (I have video evidence. Over 20 minutes.) -Tons of microtransactions. -Takes MANY hours to earn in-game money. -Prices for guns. -Co-op mission capping. When rank 1-8 you can only play two missions. -There are three different in-game currencies. They should make this one or two. Three is TOO MANY.  GOOD THINGS: -Fun when not dying. -Great controls. -A deep game that you and your friends can play. -Researching guns to get them for lower prices. -Easy friend to game connectivity. -You can vote to ban players. -Can report players abusing the game. -Great Engine  Suggestions: -Adding a way to preview a gun in the safe house before buying it.  In conclusion, this game is very fun if you don't have hackers in your lobby, and you're willing to invest a LOT of time. Overall this game gets a 7/10 (nearly 6/10) because of hackers.

It's really a good game, if you can excuse the server infrastructure, and can play long enough to realize it isn't pay-to-win.  I'll preface this on the pay-to-win: The weapons are priced with Kredits only (the microtransaction) because you haven't unlocked them. If you want the weapon, there are vendors in the game where you gain equipment to purchase with the in-game currency. You select from one of three and you play a match. Your match performance puts progress towards both your rank and vendor of choice. When you complete a vendor, you get the reward they presented you with. For weapons and outfit, you will have to buy it, but it's unlocked to purchase with the in-game currency. For accessories, you get them straight-out and can equip them to the weapon they support.  It's called a progression system. Play the game, make progress. I've been in the closed beta since it was accepting invites, I know the game.  Otherwise, it runs well enough, the controls are decent, and most everything can be bound to anything (previously, my Mouse4 and 5 couldn't be bound, but as of the Steam release, I can). The graphics are nice, but forgive Crytek for not knowing how video settings work, which disappoints a little seeing as it's a PC title.  Gunplay is nice, the implementation of teamplay is smooth, although it isn't emphasized much in the maps. Speaking of, the maps are smaller than Medal of Honor's multiplayer (which was smaller than CoD, basically). You can play versus, which is where the meat of the game seems to exist, but there's a co-op mode that uses the classes well.  So yeah...  Pros - Good gunplay, teamplay, co-op is fun, versus is fun, most of the stuff is affordable when you're putting out good games.  Cons - Servers tend to be laggy almost always, maps are small, lackluster graphics settings, and vague description of the progression system, giving it this false indication that it's a Pay-to-win title when it's not.

This game is soo much fun i ♥♥♥♥ myself and cried and fell off my chair,great game i have soo much fun with getting shot by pay to win guns and also also not being awared guns that i unlocked and having santa killing me on a continuous loop with a long range shotgun(give me your kids so i dont cry).

As a Free to play you need to invest a decent amount of grinding before you get some decent permanent gear and armor, It will take atleast 8 solid hours just to unlock a few novice items, but as you start the game will shower you with some nice weapons that are temporary. id probably say 6/10 for fun in pve starting off, its a bit better than okay. If you play it like as a premium game then money could be better spent but you will get a lot more enjoyment out of it. Pve missions are really fun when you get a well balanced group that isnt selfish with support, but this brings me to the cons of the game. Its hard to get a balanced team unless you already play a match or grab a group of friends a chat before a private match, this is because there is no server browser and you are thrown into a game without knowing which class to pick, so sometimes it can be a game full of only snipers or assaults and you get slaughtered, on a side note the game is generous with premium respawn tokens if you want to respawn early to save the game. this game is largely freemium but is very playable if you dont want to spend money. Graphics and optimization, This game is actually pretty well optimized and can easily run 40-60 fps on a cheap or older computer on medium settings. It looks decent, not too pretty but the map and level designs are very intuitive. The only major problem I have with the graphics is that no matter what I change in graphics or even my nvidia control panel there is a very ugly type of blur, even after turning motion blur off you can see after frame trails of your weapon and anything near you, but its not that bad and its pretty easy to get used to. I was starting to get very bored but then I learned they change their levels up. Even though the game asks for money in a lot of places I have to give some respect on the fact they are very generous with free items at the start and level up to give a boost to you if you are having a tough time getting some decent gear. Overall I enjoy it, Im not too fond of the pvp as the level and gamemode selection is pretty small and it can get boring fast. Its definitly something to enjoy playing here and there but you will normally get bored then have to wait for some different levels.

I have a mixed opinion about the game. While it can be a fun enough game, there's a fair amount of cons that ruin the fun. I do and don't recommend this game, and here's why :  Pros : -Guns don't completely overpower one another -The game keeps you going by having to unlock things -Most Co-Op missions are swapped out daily -Fair amount of upgrades for your character -Co-Op requires a good amount of teamwork *This also means that the team has to consist of at least 3 of the 4 classes with a team of 3^, if you want to be successful -Easy-to-use controls -Actions are easy to do and are beneficial  Cons : -Co-Op isn't that great, gets boring after the first few co-op missions *The game requires players to play Co-Op to unlock some new gear -Most weapons require real money to keep permanently, instead of 1, 7, or 30 days -PvP isn't very fun after a while due to various reasons: *People dropshot too often *Spawn camping is insane *Medics serve little purpose in PvP since you can respawn right after death *Maps are incredibly small, disabling a need for any tactical play *Snipers are rendered useless on almost every map, due to the small map size -Co-Op gets to be a bit repetitive -Great weapons are cheap, allowing new players to get an amazing weapon *This is both a pro and a con, but listed under con because it takes away some of the purpose of Co-Op -Medic is used more for close quarters rather than reviving teammates *The medics are equipped with a shotgun, while other classes aren't  Overall, I would recommend this game to anybody who's played Fps's (First-Person-Shooters) such as CoD when it was good (Before MW3 in my opinion), Battlefield, and Rainbow Six. Don't expect the game to be amazing, for me it's more a game to play when I'm bored with nothing else to do.I've been playing this for MONTHS and I have to say it's one of the BEST Co-Op games i've ever played with my friends since Left 4 Dead 2! I highly recommend this for anyone who enjoys those types of games that force you to work together along with other live players!noobs be like : pay to win. me be like : pay to not grind and the grind for me was like 20 hrs or less  i don't care if there are weapons you need to buy to be 'better'.... because i can do good with the stock weapons (Default weps) . If you play a while ( for me it took 20 hrs as i said , not too much) you can unlock and buy weapons with your own money (money from playin' stuff) , which are pretty the same with the ones you buy with real money .   cons :  - i hate dem shotguns -sometimes, hackers can ruin your match , either if they are on your team ( stealing kills , no points ) or in the enemy team ( killing you non stop , your k/d rate will blow up ) , but you can kick them if you have lucky teammates which hates hackers too  pros:  -now it has a new gamemode between co op and versus ( capture , storm , death match , team death match and others ) they introduced survival with a few missions with link between them ( the final from one is logic and makes sense with the beginning of the next mission ) which is pretty good . -good for playing with friends ( co op , survival ) or alone (versus)  edit : looks like they noticed a lot of negative reviews and they made a major change: a part of this called 'pay to win' , has a name 'crown money' , which fortunately are available for all players now . How so ? Well you can get them from daily insane missions ( there are 3 types : easy , hard , insane) or by playing co op with friends (there are some parameters like : if u did the most kills or a lot of kills you will get some of those crown money , and if you and your squad manage to do the mission in a short time, again you will get crown bonus) . But that's not all. You get crown money when you lvl up, and this is quite nice, in my opinion.  Another pro thing : Speaking of leveling up, when you level up you get a 3 hours VIP booster, which means u will get exp bonus , money bonus , and vendors exp bonus ( there is a list of common , rare , and very rare weapons , and vendors exp when you level up on vendors u get a random weapon from those common , rare and very rare )   Overall, they made the game better, i mean u can buy vip weapons without spending a penny, but you don't need to, if you are good with the normal weapons. I recommend this game : 8/10

Really amazing team-based game. I love it to death, it has a lot of aspects that I think make it better than most Call of Duty franchise games. I usually download free games, get disappointed, than uninstall. When I opened this up and had to create an account, I thought to mysel, 'Oh, another one of these.' But despite my first impressions from that, I created my free account and was on my way. I opened it up, saw a prety cool interface (seeing that it was made using Cryengine made me want to explore the gameplay). I went into a cooperative mission and found a good lobby without delay or lag. I was pretty impressed. After that I went and found a Team Death Match Plaver versus Player match and had a lot of fun (although I got absolutely ♥♥♥♥♥. But it was a fun ♥♥♥♥). No lag.   Time for the Pro and Con list! The only thing that you guys read.     PROS:   -Great gameplay -Good quality servers -Cool Cooperative play -Great PvP -Great graphic quality -It's free!    CONS:   -Requires you to create free account -Your favourite guns will expire -In game purchases (optional) [It's a free game, what did I expect?] -Way too many items in your toolbelt -Takes awhile to increase your rank    THE NEUTRAL ZONE!!!!:   -Team set spawn point -Certain snipers' points require two people to access    OVERALL: 8/10   6/10 say it's better than the newest installments of Call of Duty

After 3 days of intense gaming, i am ready to make this review.   Pay to Win ?  There are a lot of Pay2Win FPS games on the net... in most of them, is very difficult to gain necessary credits/points to buy premium things and kill people faster... unless you spend real money. Warface is a bit different, more you kill... more money you get. Premium things are quite cheap and durable. 8/10   Playable ?  The game is a wonderful mix of Call of Duty Series with Combat Arms and Crysis... Fast, Reliable, Wonderful Graphics, Optimized, Nice Controls... 10/10  Connection ?  This is the weakest point of the game... There aren't dedicated servers in the game. Connections are peer to peer like game-consoles... 5/10  Conclusion   Awesome alternative to Call of Duty series. Don't doubt to try this.

Warface is a barley decent free to play shooter, and while its not better than most of the mainstream fps games on the market it does feel better made than many of the other free to play cash shop fps games out there. Warface has been out for a while so when I got the chance to play it on Steam, I went for it. Overall the game feels like it was built with team play, and tactical thinking in mind, with each class having a 'specialty' or role to fill. What we got however was not so much that game.   If you play Warface like a frantic arena shooter you will have more fun than trying to be 'tactical' and specialize roles with your teammates. Its much easier, and overall more fun to just rush into combat and shoot everyone, you'll get more xp and its a lot faster than trying to fill your role. An example I can give of this is my time playing as a medic. I was always at the ready, trying to heal my team, but it was hard when they would keep running away from you, while you try to heal them. Trying to revive a teammate with chest paddles was even harder, most of the time they would just opt to respawn instead of waiting the extra second or so for me to finish the animation for the revive. I was only ever able to save about one in ten teammates while playing as a medic. I also must point out that as a medic, you are one of the most brutal classes in the game, you can rush in to battle with a shotgun and easily kill 5 guys, self heal up, and then rush back in to kill five more. The respawn times are fast in most game modes so there is not that much of a reason to play it 'safe'.   Overall I like warface, it looks great and it plays pretty average for a free to play shooter. The biggest draw back for me is the cash shop, making there a possibility for huge pay to win, and that really the game is just an arena shooter under the skin of a modern fps. Get ready to run, hipfire your gun, kill five guys, die and do it all again! Its fun, but you may get bored easily. I think that you should at least try the game after all its free, what can it hurt?

Pretty crude co-op/vs shooter but can be fun. Enemy AI is generally poor and they act as bullet sponges. Guns feel weak and generally you have to pump 10-20 rounds into a target before going down. Take it for what it is...this is the game version of those pulpy sci fi type action flicks you watch on a saturday afternoon when it's pouring with rain. It's stupid fun.   The co-op is improved (like most games) hugely with a good team. They have tried to do some neat things to encourage team work (buddy climbing etc).   This game is not pay to win (at least not in co-op) which is nice. Other weapons can be bought with real world money or in game xp type rewards however a great deal of new gear, guns etc can only be rented.  Visually the game is built on cryengine but has clearly been downscaled so it can be used on a large number of platforms. It's not super ugly but definately doesn't have some of the graphical flair and post processing fx of even the original Crysis.   Levels are generally small and tight and the edges of the maps are often crudely done (basic box skyscrapers with low res textures spring to mind).  Grab this game as a free to play distraction especially if you have some buddies that like co-op. Generally though the community seems pretty good, even if they don't speak much.  I keep thinking this game is meh but then it keeps drawing me back for 30mins or so to play it.  Overall if you are into co-op give this one a try, why not it's free right?  p.s. just played versus it's fun kind of in the COD mode of things, nothing ground breaking.  6.5/10
for a free to play its not a bad game, there could be improvments though

THIS GAME IS IN OPEN BETA! FEATURES WILL CHANGE IN THE FUTURE AND SO WILL MY REVIEW!     Warface is an amazing Free to Play game. As much as I see people disagreeing on this topic, I do not believe that WF is Pay2Win but rather Play2Win. In Warface, you have ranks such as Cadet, Private, Corporal, Sergeant, and more. The higher your rank the more stuff you can get for a lower price and better guns at that. Now, with this out of the way, we can get on to the review.  Graphics: 7.5/10  The graphics of Warface are beautiful. Just straight-up fancy, spectacular graphics and beautiful to admire and play and immerse yourself into the world of war... that is, unless you have a high performance computer. See, the game has amazing graphics. Blood, bullets, even motion blur and the realism and rust of the guns. The downside is that it takes up a TON of performance and can lead to unplayability, making this the reason why the score is 7.5. Yes, nowadays there are great computers out there. However, many of them cannot stand the intensity of the graphics, thus causing a lack in FPS. The only way to enjoy the game without FPS lag if you have a bad computer is simply to turn the graphics settings as low as possible and try to enjoy low graphics settings.  Mechanics: 7/10  Mechanics play a huge part in the gaming industry, so people focus a ton of their time to make the game run as smooth as possible and to make things seem as realistic as possible. Warface did a really nice job of this. However, there are flaws that are noticable and can wreck other people's view of the game. Let's start with the health and armor set up.    Health and Armor are a needed feature in modern day FPS games and it is important for those features to work properly and to be as fair as possible. With Warface, the team made this game to seem like a Call of Duty type game. So, instead of having precentages and numbers, they just put 2 bars, one indicating health and the other is armor. Of course, this does not really matter with some gamers. What does matter is 'does these work?', and the answer is 'Sort of'. Why? The damage system simply needs a few tweaks is all. The damage is extremely varied. For example, at a 1 meter range with a SMG, it may do, say, 54 damage to the head. Using the same SMG at the same range shooting the head could be 34 the next time. Also for Call of Duty lovers, no regenitive health. 'Nuff said about that. Let's talk about the hitmarker. The hitmarker was a really cool feature they added in. You may be thinking 'Well, hitmarkers aren't that cool, they just show if you hit the person'. You are absolutly correct. However, that is not the case with Warface. The WF Team took it a step further and made it a damage indicator as well as a hit marker. The bigger the   X   is, the more damage you dealt in the bullet you shot. Sometimes, the   X   would 'fill up' as you may put it. There is a maximum for that   X   to fill up, which means that if you hit that maximum, it was an instant kill. That feature itself deserves a 10/10. There is one thing wrong with it, however: It sometimes doesn't give you the right information, but all in all, that hitmarker is one step closer to the future of gaming. Now, let's talk about the movement mechanics   It gets really irritating when your charactor cannot sprint for more than 2 seconds (Combat arms, I am looking at you...) or can't move faster than a snail (Again, combat arms...). Warface does an exellent job with the movement mechanics. Climbing and Sliding are very smooth and fluid. However, you can't climb most easily climbable objects that you could in real life. What I mean is, you cannot climb many things. You can climb through windows, slide through cracks in the wall, and more, but not up that rail that is juuuuust out of arms reach. But, to fix this, Warface did another amazing thing: they made it possible for teamates to 'boost' each other up. Of course, this is useless in Free For All, but it does work fluidly and is used by me all the time.   This game also has a Ranking feature, which works decently. There are challenges to complete. The more you complete, the more you rank up and the more things you can use to customize your emblem/name backround. Much like COD. That's all there is to this section.     Let's talk about the voice chat. This is the section that is the most flawed, and you can totally notice it. If you use your mic in this game, it cuts out, gets scratchy, or doesn't work at all. Also, the most annoying thing is, it feels like no one can understand you, no one can even hear you, and   doesn't have a mic to respond with   . I swear, people who type on your team can't get any more aggrivating. Half your team types and you're left with yourself and maybe a few other people on your team that type and get type killed. The rest hide in a corner to type and are of no use to you at all. Voice chat is a fail in this game. You cannot even use it in the lobby, because guess what:   You have to type   . This section brought down the mechanics section of this review.  Balance: 8/10  Of course, anyone who pays for a game will get a boost in their gameplay. But not by a lot in Warface. In Warface, I barely got started yesterday, and I am rising through the ranks and I have not even bought a gun yet. That's right, all this game needs is some skill and you are good to go! That is not the case, of course, with payers. They can buy boosts of cash and even though they don't win, they can buy enough boosts that ensure that they don't have to. It doesn't make sense if someone on the losing team gets bottom of the lobby (last place) but still gets more money than the 1st place winner on the winning team. That's what brought this part down. All in all, you just need skill, a good computer, and a gun (by that I mean the one you start with. That's all you need, really). Once you start rising in cash, you can buy a permanant gun for about $15,000 or less (sometimes, a good gun costs more, like ARs and Shotguns). On guns you buy for perm, however, you will need to keep repairing it, or else you cannot use it anymore. It's kinda like Upkeep, which in my opinion makes this game sorta like a tycoon game where you have to tend to your guns, but to me that is not a problem. Good armor is also good too. Now to the good part. Everyone who unlocks engineer gets claymore-happy. But chances are, they won't know how to use them right. They will place them in plain sight and unless you are careless, you can shoot it easy-peasy. This is not the case with experienced players (rank 5+, but even then they may not be experienced). Sometimes, clays get really annoying really fast, especially when people spawn-camp with them. Now that is the irritating part of this game. The maps are tiny (for now) and people tend to spawn-camp. Chances are, they die really quick afterwards. You get 3 second invulnerability, so that's a plus. Killcam is another cool thing to exploit. If you base knowlage ex post facto, you know exactly how to take any kind of camper down. With me, that's a little tricky. But, I will leave that up to you. Hopefully, you can play with me and learn a bit.  Overall Score: 8.5/10  Warface is an astonishing game that Gface made and I highly reccomend that you get this game and try it out for yourself and see how you think of the game. I hope this review helped you decide weather or not to try this game out. Remember, it IS in open beta, so things will change greatly. And when they do, I will be here to change my review. So long gamers.

A great Free-To-Play FPS game from on Steam!   I would recommend this game to anyone who likes to play FPS games. It's not as realistic as games like Battlefield, but it sure is a load of fun. The campaign doesn't really have much of a story to it, but that's kinda what I like about it. The campaign mode consists of co-op missions, that you play with real players online.  I also love how it has a bunch of multiplayer modes, including Team Deathmatch and Free-For-All, which are my two all times favorites. The gameplay is pretty immersive, and full of features.  Overall, A wonderful game for those who don't want to pay $30-$60 for a good quality FPS game.

Many of these negative comments don't make ANY sense. I don't care if some think I'm nuts, but I can almost smell something fishy. Someone paying off people to give this game a negative rating since it's a big threat to other f2p games?  People complaining about microtransactions, being a 'sliding simulator', small maps, etc. Belony! I haven't payed a single cent and I am doing very good and have some good & cool weapons and equipment, and I have only played it 28 hours.  It's fun and tactical. You can play coop maps, versus mode (bomd defuse etc) and survival mode. For being a f2p game, this is alot better than many other f2p games I've tried, and I've tried alot of them. In many of those I get annoyed by the almost neccesary microtransactions, well, this game is in my opinion not one of those. I play it just fine without paying. I'm having alot of fun.  Don't listen to the BS about this game, give it an honest try and you will see for yourself. Don't be fooled.

When I first downloaded this game I was very tempted to quit straight away because of the inevitable presence of double DRM. Now, double DRM is very annoying and entirely pointless - just let me log in with my Steam account, rather than waste five minutes of my life forcing me to create ANOTHER account just to play one game.  I'm glad I didn't make the foolish decision to judge the game entirely on double DRM and throw it down instantly.  What awaited me when I finally got in was an instant classic ... for a free-to-play. Although the objective of each level is mostly the same as what you'd find in the average multiplayer mode of any game, it's definitely more fluid and somewhat more enjoyable. On Co-op, the AI is tailored perfectly to the ability of each player; it's not too dumb like in the early Battlefield games, nor is it ridiculously overclocked like in Loadout. Teamwork is imperative to the survival of the squad, much unlike ninety five-percent of the other MMOFPS games I've played recently (PlanetSide 2 for one), and it's very well optimised. In fact, the only real downside is that enemy bullets (in Co-op anyway) do too little damage to matter to a well-organised fireteam, and rushing the enemy head on seems to be an IWIN button. At least, for the levels titled Initiation - I haven't played much further than that.

For those who like to get to the point. I recommend because it's fun at least initially and it's free. If you don't like it after trying it then delete it and your only out the time to download (not a loss since you can play other games while it's downloading) and uninstall. So give it a try and from what I can gather it's better than the overpriced call of duty black ops III. But thats just from reading the reviews.  Pros: - Free to play (no cost for the quality)  - Solid FPS game, that allows you to upgrade your items (weapons, armor, etc)  - Multiplayer (though lack of cohesiveness among squadmates suck)  - 4 classes of soldiers (type,specialty,weapon type): RIFLEMAN, ammo resupply, rifle; MEDIC, revive, shotgun; ENGINEER, quickest bomb plant/deacitvate, smg; SNIPER, no special, sniper rifle. You can mix and match and none are required. In essence you can all be snipers or rifleman, but does come in handy to have a rifleman and medic on your team.  - New maps regularly  - Bonuses just for playing daily (cash which you keep or free weapons temporary such as a day, 3 days, etc)  - Can earn weapons or armor doing missions (you get to pick what you work towards out of 3 choices)  Cons:  - Two seperate currencies one earned during mission/matches, other purchased with real money (will explain next). Wish they would allow it stay the way it is (for those who want it) but have a reasonable all in price as I'm old school like that and would prefer to buy a game outright and have everything.  - Pay to win in PvP, as you need to spend real money to purchase the best weapons permenantly (with kreds) otherwise with cash earned you can only 'rent' them for a certain amount of time. As far as I can tell, may be wrong and just haven't played long enough. In essence you can earn enough cash to purchase the standard weapons and rent the best.   - Also have to pay to repair weapons. To me not a bad thing (as it adds some realism) just adds to the grind.  - Menu is convoluted (complicated) in some respects. Such as to go back to the previous screen after checking your inventory click 'play' right next to 'Warface'. Took me a little bit to realize it.  - This one isn't for me but I've seen complaints of people being automatically kicked out of mission/matches for high latency (ping). This is good as nobody wants lag (Devs: maybe also try to match latency along with skill/chosen match instead of kicking.  Summary: It's a solid free to play game, but I can see where it turns into a pay to win in PvP. Only regular items are available to buy with in-game currency that you can earn (as far as I can tell). As for the best items you have to spend real money to get what they call Kreds to be able to get them (maybe it's just sooner this way). It's a solid PvE (co-op) game that's once you get used to it is a joy to play.

A good alternative to Warframe co-op.  Pros:  - Co-op missions - Variety of missions - Amount of guns and loadouts you can use - Fun, somewhat challenging (PVE) - Has a PVP mode for those interested in it - Easy to learn - F2P  Cons:  - PVP. I don't like how you require so many hits to kill an enemy (they even have headshot protecting gear, which in fact costs quite a bit of ingame currency to buy) - Lag in PVP and PVE, sometimes hits don't seem to register or just generally makes aiming harder. - Too limited and somewhat unprecise movement - Costy equipment and guns in the store - It has modern browser FPS graphics, the same as in beta some years back. - Missions can get repetitive - Requires you to create a GFACE account.   Give it a try if you like playing co-op FPS games.  7.5/10

dispite what people say its pretty fun, the combat system is similar to CoD without all the exploits, fast pace  also dispite what people say it isnt a pay to win, there are no one sided guns, most of the guns are balanced, only difference is a slight change in accuracy, damage, rate of fire, etc etc, letting you get the right balance that suits your play style, unlike the sniper classes for most game it isnt a bunch of 'quick scoping'. the learning curve is very small  the gear system is similar to battlefield play4free, you dont really 'buy' the weapon, more of renting it, it makes people work for what they want, encourages people to play more and more. these 'rented' gear and weapons last a couple weeks to even a month, in that time you will most like make 6x the amount you paid to rent it, even if you only play 3-5 days out of the 15-30. but there are permanent gear.  8/10, deffinatly something i would play on a regular basis, if you have problems getting it started, make sure you confirm your email. the site is a bit sluggish atm but give it some time and it will work perfectly

Playing games like Crysis 1, 2, and 3, i expected the game to be similar to that because its made by the same developers behind that, unfortunatly the game plays like a turtle compared to the speed that is Crysis. It has a good focus on teamwork, by having a specific medic class that can revive people, which is good to a certain extent, but ive seen noone play medic so far, so revivals get thrown out the window.  Crytek have tried to make this game fast paced, although having to MANUALLY switch to grenades (and even a knife) only causes quick deaths and lost points. The difference between players and the lag between one soldier and another is annoying, this occured in Call of Duty: Black Ops where i could put 15-20 rounds into someone only to have them one shot me in a milisecond (according to my screen).   The game is riddled with microtransactions (like all F2P games though), which can suck up more money that you can shake a stick at. The control scheme is typical of all FPS's, simple but effective.  Overall, the game is ok but doesnt do anything different, it's an FPS with nothing special to it, it doesnt throw any wildcards or have anything hidden up its sleeve. It may be updated with new content but who knows?

Been playing this game before it ever came to Steam. I got introduced to Warface when it arrived on the Xbox 360. I looked it up and found out it was most popular on the PC, where it evolved. So I downloaded in on the PC as well. I gotta say, it saddened me to see that it didn't last on the Xbox 360. I really enjoyed it on there. But now it's time for my review.  This game is a nice change of pace. If your used to Call Of Duty or Battlefield. Thrown what you know out the door. I feel this game, with a COD feel. Has realistic gun play. Much more than COD. I love the fact that you can pair up to 4 people and complete missions as well. Instead of just head hunting each other all the time. The things I'm not a fan of in any game is micro-transactions. I understand that this is a free to play game and they need to make money. Agree 100%, but this game can honestly be a game that can be sold for X amount of dollars and I'm sure many people will purchase it. Like I said, not a fan of micro-transactions. Makes this feel like pay to win.  All in all this game is fun, it's a nice break for tryhards on COD and Battlefield. I suggest this free game to anyone out there who loves a good FPS. It's free, what do you have to lose? Exactly, nothing... give it a good try. I'm sure you will keep it around :)

Pros: -Good graphics -Many maps -Plenty of guns -Runs very well, considering the graphics engine -Diverse classes -Multiple game modes -Is free to play/has a fair business model -Cool customization  Cons: -Some of the maps share one bad design(2 static spawn points; 1 or more chokepoints within the small space in between) -The sniper rifles are game-breakingly overpowered -95% of the guns are locked until you reach level 9 -The amount of money you earn per game is inconsistent  Nitpicks: -Some guns that should have a really high rate of fire, are at less than 800rpm -PhysX is badly optimized  Levels 1-8: Fun, but there's like one other gun that isn't locked until level 9, and it has godawful accuracy Level 9+: Hackers, campers, overpowered guns, and frustration  Don't get me wrong, I still think the game is good, and still recommend it, but be prepared to rage after getting to level 9. I've earned over 200 Warface dollars with 10 kills in one match, yet only earn like 64 in my most recent match, with 10 kills. It's really annoying; especially when you have to pay to repair your equipment, and getting new guns is a grind, if you want them permanently. It doesn't help that everybody has a ♥♥♥♥ing hard-on for sniper rifles when you get past level 9. You could should shoot someone's foot, and get a kill. The fact that they're even useful in close quarters, is such a travesty. Let's not even get started on the semi-automatic sniper rifles. Those are just all the butthurt in the world, formed into a gun. They're the king of overpowered weaponry.

Warface is a Great game. It's a Team based game in witch you play as one of four classes. One, the Rifleman who has   a MG and can give his team mates ammo. Two, the Medic who has a Shotgun and can heal his buddys. Three, the   Sniper, he can sit back, help and and make sure that his team mates can get to the goal with-out being taking a long   shot by campers and other Snipers. Four, the Engineer, he has a SMG and can plant mines and hack into stuff. The co-  op missons are fun and hard, they make you work together as a Real team, and you will not just be able to run in with   4 or 5 Rifleman andhope to 'spray and pray' If you try something like that... Let's just say it will turn out bad for   you.    The Versus matches are a lot of fun too. I like Plant the Bomb best cuz you also have to work as a Team to Defend the   Bomb sites and to Aattck them as well. I do not have to say much about Team Deathmatch cuz everyone know about it   but it is a LOT of fun if you all go as a team and just kill everyone in your way :) Capture is good too cause you have like   30 mins to win, in the end it's a killbox by the Capture points lol. The guns are good too and I like how you can give   your gun red lasers, grips and stuff like that. Some guns you can only buy with real money but it's not just them, you   can buy a lot of good guns with-out real money. you may have to put some time in it but hey your going to play the   game anyway :)

Warface is a fast paced gameplay and awesome violence. If you're playing this game you need to think fast for a strategy, shoot the enemies fast, and run quick towards the objective to beat the enemy. Each class has their own role such as the Rifleman gives ammo to his/her teammates. The Sniper / Marksman his/her role is to eliminate futher threats to support teammates to move forward also they can also kill and scout enemies from a distance. If you're using the Sniper class you'd better be patient and suffiecient. The 3rd class is the Medic now this is the important class this is between your life or death because he/she gives you med packs also when you die the medic will revive with a defibrillator so you'd better be fast to help and heal your team or they'd die. Last class that'd be the Engineer he/she is capable of repairing you're vest/armor to absorb less damage but it takes a few seconds to repair itand the best part you can arm/plant a bomb did you know you can defuse it. Now really what I've expected from the Engineer class in warface was to build traps , turrets and explosives and to plant them anywhere able to plant them. now the coolest part was shooting while sliding to kill the hostile/enemy did ya know when u come across the hardest obstacle make sure you can help them climb up or help u climb up to move on. If my review helped you can like or reply me to thank me, If not that's ok I'm not really good makin reviews its my first time anyways. Well God Bless Everyone!

The game is pretty good and it really is a lot of fun. It could use some tweaking though.  I just want to mention a few negatives that are the reason I wrote a review: You can expect to be killed by claymores and grenades a lot. Everything feels clunky. The soldiers can only sprint for about 10 feet and it takes ages to switch weapons even though it is an arcade shooter (similar to COD). Even the game speed feels clunky I'm running it over 120fps but it sure doesn't feel like it. Using the 'special' equipment slot requires cycling through them with the same button as opposed to having a seperate button for each item which is weird. Those are the only real complaints I have and I have a lot of fun playing this game. The action is intense, the gunplay is solid, the matches are a perfect length, the community seems decent, and it's free. So check it out.

This is a pretty darn good game. By the fact I've already played it for 13 hours in under 2 weeks shows this game has both an addictive nature and a challenging nature that keeps you coming back to the missions. The intensity of the gameplay is far beyond the normal gameplay of games such as COD or Halo, the missions provide a range of difficulty, primarily vey hard, however. The game is a very standout FPS among many free to play FPS games which usually end up being below par. The abnormal difficulty is what I believe brings people to play this game for many hours on end, and the strong cooperative focus is something that is personally what I look for in a game, and even to the point of me wishing the devs would make updates for even crazier co-op. One thing I have wanted to see that hasn't been focused on is air combat. Despite many of the missions being focused on stopping a helicopter from smuggling various things, I haven't seen any combat take place in these helicopters, and I would absolutely love to see that become a part of this game. Other than that, Crytek is definitely a company I will be looking into for PC games.

This game is like a combination of Warframe and Counter-Strike.   The co-op PvE plays a lot like Warframe ie a team goes in and kills everything in sight. There is also the unlock system, which also plays a bit like Warframe where you unlock better gear by grinding. Warframe has a lot more grind though.   The PvE plays a lot like Counter Strike, atleast the Death-Match and Free-for-All parts. Just fast-paced, twitch based shooter with some tactics thrown in.  There is a cash shop, but I don't think it is P2W. Better gear almost always trumps skills, and a good level 1 player witch basic gear can wreck a level 10 player.   Cons -  -It's a F2P title, so expect a lot of grind and cash shop.

Cons: - Grinding for guns can get really annoying - The auto balance system needs some serious work - Shotguns are really strong - Toggle sprint (wish I could change it to holding the sprint button) - Sliding is also really strong (I can barely see people when they slide) - In game money honestly gets you nothing - Animations take way too long (Such as reloading/swithing guns/throwing grenades)  Pros: - NOT PAY TO WIN (Almost nothing is pay to win in this game, really hard to find these kinds of free to play games that aren't pay to win) - No flying around everywhere - Has the old style shooter feel to it - Runs well even with a horrible computer - Has a co-op mode - Has futureistic guns but features maps that seem to be set in a world war 1/2 era - Very fun to play - Good charactor animation (Unlike in games like tf2 the charactor animations make the game feel much more realistic. Also making targets easier to hit) - Snipers aren't too terribly unbalanced (Not many spots in most of the maps that make camping over powered) - Different servers for different skill levels (You won't find any level 13+ players in you lobby as a level 1) - Leveling up doesn't take long upon starting the game  8/10 Would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for an older style free to play low performance FPS.

This is TL;DL and just skip to the end for my score.  War face is ... Generic in most aspects. It does not bring anything new to the FPS genre, but yet I still play it ... It has 4 classes which you can choose from and each their own weapons and play style. Rifleman uses assault rifles LMG's with the ability to resupply ammo to themselves and team. Medics can use shotguns and can heal and revive the team. Engineers use SMG's and they can place directional Mines while repairing armor for themselves and team. Lastly Snipers dont have any unique traits but the only thing is that they can deal high damage over long distances. The game is set-up for Cooperative gameplay right as soon as you login. You get to choose from 6 co-op missions that change everyday, 3 'Special Operations' which give really good payouts and a random item upon completion and lastly PvP mode which has 8 games to choose from. If you have friends it asks you before you join a game if you would want to invite them. The Devs update things every once in a while. The rotate new missions in and out and bring in newer Special Operative missions which are longer, much more difficult, and a drastically higher payout with unique rewards.   To unlock weapons/armor/attachments in the game, you have to earn VP which is won by completing missions and/or PvP matches. Once you unlock them, they are yours. In some instances you buy them with in-game currency, no biggie. Others are unlocked by level and you can buy them for 1 day, 7 days, or permanently. There are unique weapons and armor sets that require 'Crowns' for purchase. Crowns are earned by completing co-op missions. These are the 'elite' sets mostly recognized by their Orange color. They add stat and other bonuses to your character which gives a slight edge to your gameplay. Certain 'Special' weapons/armors are awared by completing the Spec Ops missions and they can have awesome advantages and perks.   Some of the main flaws with the game are that everyone is selfish and/or point ♥♥♥♥♥s, with the occasional hacker-central here or there. What I mean by selfish is that the majority of folks you play with dont adapt to the team. For example, everyone is either Assault or Sniper. There are barely ANY medics, besides myself. Another issue is poeple dashing or running super far ahead of everyone and getting themselves or the team killed. They would then blow up the message box telling you to 'rush to the next checkpoint' or 'just go' because they just want to be dumb and watch everyone die like they did. This normally occurs if you play the harder or Insane difficulty missions, and sadly even the easier ones. No one has a sense of Unit Cohoesion or cooperative play, hell let alone tactical prowess when you do missions or spec ops which makes you wonder why do you play as the supportive roles. They rush into danger and get themselves killed and ♥♥♥♥♥ at you to get shot at to revive them. Not alot of people play their class roles and there are only a small few people who have a tactical sense and work well with a team. It gets infuriating trying to heal or repair armor and the person youre helping just runs around like some CoD junky.  There are hackers here n there and its the main reason I stay away from the PvP elements. I dont call folks newbs or whatever because I know im not that great at PvP and my K/D spread is at a 0.9, I dont really care. But its when I get killed from a headshot by a dude across the map who is in a random corner shooting through walls. Or in a Domination game, they capture all posts instantly without moving an inch. Its things like that that become irritating to engage in PvP. There are very few that Ive noticed in the PvE portion, but I dont see anyone complaining. The matchmaking is unbalanced for new players. Youre thrust into any room or any game with people who outrank you with better gear. I understand the debate with skill vs gear and I did rock some people with just basic stuff but it gets kinda obvious that it takes quite a bit more hits to take down some people.   In my honest opinion... It gets a 6/10. I recommend it to people who want a quick taste of 'team FPS' other than dirty bomb... or TF2. I do like that the game is updated and changed frequently its great. The devs still have not made changes to playing a supportive role. You just get ♥♥♥♥ on by everyone for not being a rambo dumbass with no sense of tactical prowess.

I have 1,177.2 hrs on record for this game at the time im writing/wrote this. So, let me give you a run down of what its like:  -> Classes:  ~Rifleman: Just your average, run and gun player. Nothing special than just being able to replenish your ammo when you're either done spraying & praying or when you eat the other team like its nothing with weapons that seem like they hold more bullet than you'd think.  ~Medic: Run around a corner against a Medic and you're guaranteed to lose. 9 out of 10 times, unless you headshot them first. Look out for automatic shotguns if you're against medics, and if you're a medic.. your best bet is automatic shotguns. They're extremely OP.  ~Engineer: Just like rifleman honestly. And its probably your best bet on PTB or any mode where you have to plant ♥♥♥♥, destroy ♥♥♥♥, basically anything needed to be done fast, Eng will end that ♥♥♥♥ like Mike Tyson fighting a infant.  ~Sniper: Good luck because this is where the most problems you'll see later in this review will come from. OP snipers and automatics are the biggest thing you'll find around Warface. So prepare to get ♥♥♥♥ed by Snipers.  -> Gameplay  ~PVE/Survival Missions: The PVE missions under Co-op are basically the same ones over and over again so after 10 times, you get the jist of what to do, and where to go. And you can speed rush the ♥♥♥♥ out of it. But with survival.. there is videos by other content creators that spend hours playing their survival missions such as Marathon, HQ, Earth Shaker, etc. They put more work into their survival missions, than their co-op missions. And probably more than their PVP maps.   ~PVP: You're basically ♥♥♥♥ed in this. Lag is the worst thing you'll experience during PVP. There's 3 ♥♥♥♥in servers. And Not everyone plays on their own specific server. Turkey, EU, and North America. Because people dont play on their server, or because they dont have a server that works for them. They basically lag like crazy and you're ♥♥♥♥ed if you arent one of them. Yellow Bar players will never die, unless you're full of miracles. Red pingers will die, but its a toss up of how they will work. They'll die like normal, or they'll be just like Yellow Bars. Now.. White Bars. 2 Bars ♥♥♥♥ing suck like Yellow Bars. They tank shots like crazy. You'll have a 1 in 10 chance of killing a White 2 Bar. If Harambe had 2 White Bars, he'd be alive on Warface terms. 3 White Bars.. they are a give and take like Red Bars. They'll die.. or they wont. 4 Bars and 5 Bars.. are basically God in a nutshell. They will headshot the holy ♥♥♥♥ out of you before you get around the corner, or they'll eat your bullets like Its an open buffet at Golden Corral. If you see 4 Bars, you're just S.O.L.  -> Final Conclusion:  ~ All in all.. i'd say Warface is a great game despite their many flaws. Ping is an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥, and if you dont have god ping, you're ♥♥♥♥ed unless you're either a hacker, or you have luck that the rest of us dont have. I'd play this over CoD probably 7 out of 10 times. While the community isnt that well on Warface, you dont have to listen to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥ squeakers or people with mics up their ♥♥♥ and coming out their esophagus.

Underwhelming.  After seeing this game advertised at several game expo's over the last 2 1/2 years, I will say that I'm not too impressed with how this game turned out.  I've played a few matches of this game at different game shows, like Euro gamer or Gamescon, however the game doesn't feel or look different to any other first person shooters out on the market. It feels like Gotham City Impostors, Battlefield Play4Free, Allience of Viliant Arms or Arctic combat.  The aestetics and gameplay style of this game is typical of online multiplayer first person shooters aimed at the low budget market, even though there are better games on the market.

Warface is a bad game.  Like most F2P games, you'll need to make an account. No big deal, just a hassle. You also will have to put up with Warface using its own independent launcher, which means it updates outside of Steam. When Marvel Heroes has shown that F2P games can update from the Steam platform with few headaches, it's hard to give launchers a pass anymore.  Anyways, the game proper is very fond of its status as a co-op focused FPS. And Warface is, in fact, a co-op focused FPS. On the surface, it looks like you have a great new game for you and your buddies. Each day, a new rotation of missions is put in play, requiring you to complete the lower tiers of dificulty before the harder missions become available. So you'll do some mindless shooting, then get down to more objective based missions, and then get your ♥♥♥ handed to you in the highest tier content. Fun, right? No. Not fun. Don't you ever make that mistake again.  The thing about this content 'climb' is that there's no matching progression on the player side. You'll easily complete those first two missions each day, and then naively jump into the newly unlocked mission only to get absolutely slaughtered. You might make some progress, but eventually, there's a point where the game reminds you that you aren't using the 'cool stuff' yet, and will have you looking for the 'quit game' button.  On top of its hamfisted attempt at forcing players to spend money to have fun, the game doesn't always tell you the whole story. When you first start the game, you get a message saying that you can do a quick tutorial, and as a reward, they'll give you a free gun, a pair of gloves, and some in game currency. Having played the game in an earlier beta, I jumped on that offer.  Of course, after completing the training and looking at my inventory, I discovered that both the gun and gloves were set to expire in 24 hours. Nowhere did it tell me that beforehand, and they had never said it'd be a permanent reward, but it still comes across as gross and impersonal.  There are four classes in Warface, but for some reason, the devs have locked two of them away until you reach certain points in your ranking progression. This is great, because every match needed to be nothing but guys with sniper rifles and M16s. Who needs medics and engineers? This wasn't the case in the earlier build I played, and is a mindboggling change. Do they think players won't understand how the complicated mechanics of 'equip this, click to heal' work?  There is PVP as well, but it's an afterthought that you'd be better off ignoring. Honestly, I suggest you ignore this game entirely. Everything is designed in such a way that they hope you'll be tempted to open your wallet (Hey, you may be dead, but if you spend some money, you can revive yourself. Blatant disregard for our own games design is meaningless when it means making a quick buck!), unlocking new guns, attachments, and equipment is both luck and a grind. You have to select one of the three you'd like to work towards, and you can't choose which item in each you are working for. So if you don't want that sniper suit in the outfit section, well, it's going to stay the only thing you will get from outfit until you give up and unlock it over something in weapons or attachments. Great.  I had last played Warface during the closed beta, what feels like a year ago now. With the release on Steam, I was surprised to find that the game has actually actively become worse. The developers think you are an idiot, and will spend money at the slightest provocation. Don't prove them right.

My Background in other FPS games (context):  1,500 hours in CSGO. Thousands of hours in the Battlefield franchise. A few hundred hours in Call of Duty games.   Maps and Game Play:  The Warface maps are small--smaller even than Counter Strike, which is criticized for small maps. I'm not impressed with the Warface maps. They don't lend themselves to holding angles like CSGO. They aren't big like Battlefield. They aren't even tactically as good as COD. I struggle to understand the map design. They don't promote skill based play.  So if we're not holding angles and have precision based shooting like CSGO. And we're not dealing with a larger, tactical map like Battlefield. What are we doing in Warface?   You can do these unrealistic, arcade style slides? 9 times out of 10, I easily kill the arcade slider in close combat.   The other terrible game mechanic is toggling rapidly between laying prone and standing up. You can switch so fast that it looks like a   supernatural zombie.  In medium to close combat, expect the prone toggler but its not that hard to spray them down.  I enjoyed playing the game, but the maps and gameplay options just get old. The prone toggling and arcade sliding, while fun at first, don't lend themselves to long term game play.   Pay to Play or Win:  You can pay for better weapons. Some claim you can get these weapons for free by grinding XP. Yes, you can.   But you can't afford to use them afterwards! Try using some of the best weapons, armor, boots, etc in the game. You will pay HUGE repair costs after each mission. You will pay more for the repair costs than you made on the mission. Forget pay to win. It's pay to play.  Think about it. It's a free game. Repair costs are there to force you to pay to use the weapon. The whole game mechanic is designed to force you to spend money (or the game can't exist). Or not be able to use the weapons you either purchased or unlocked through grinding levels and XP.   Hacks : If you have played other FPS games, you know there will always be hacks. Rather than a real anti-cheat that detects when the game's memory has been compromised, they opted for Fair Fight. Fair Fight is a performance based anti-cheat, where if you play substantially better suddenly you can be banned. There's other factors as well.  The problem is hack sites that sell wallhacks and aimbots also provide guides for getting around Fair Fight. A lot of it is common sense about doing better slowly, not following people through walls, not following people who can't see you, etc.  I've seen more wallhacks in Warface than I saw in CSGO, Battlefield, and COD combined. It's infested. There's even people in game advertising hack sites. It's easy (but not always reliable) to scream aimbot in any game. The truth is, any aimbot shot COULD have been made by a skilled player. It's easier for me to spot a wallhacker and in Warface, there's always going people who ALWAYS know where everyone is.  I have seen dozens of people Fair Fight banned. I just think with the guides out there for getting around Fair Fight, many are getting around it.  Develop a real anti-cheat that detects when the game has been hooked.   Summary:  If you want a Battlefield type of game, with super small maps, less tactical options, and prone togglers, then play this game.   If you get beat in other FPS games, just spend money on this game. You can buy super fast boots that make you run much faster. You can buy health regenerating vests that will take you from near death to 100%. You dream it--you can buy it. And maybe even win, assuming you find a game without a wall hacker. ;)

If there's something I really liked about this game is the way you unlock stuff. Overall, really cool game with a lot of potential, but if the devs want the game to be big, they should start caring about it a bit more, improve ther support team and get rid of all the hackers, if that ever were to happen, I'd give the game a nice 8/10.

Doesn't seem like it's worth trying again.

It's not a terrible game by any means, it's quite fun at times, and some of the modes are quite fun like Capture and Storm. However the cons cancel out the pros and then some in my opinion.  Pros:  Lots of maps  Most maps are well designed  Classes are balanced  Runs great (was staying above 100fps maxed out on my mid-range rig)   Quite a lot of modes  A few colorful maps that come as a surprise (the Brazil map is beautiful)   The hub is well done and clean (I really like how you add on attachments)   Slide function is really fun and fluid  Some team work aspects are cool, like helping one another to reach places.  Free  Not a big download   Cons:  Some maps are copied and pasted  it will cost you OVER $400 to purchase all the permanent gear and weapons   Visuals are sub-par for a Crytek game  Hit detection is pretty awful  Several modes are just poorly executed compared to other games  Options menu is lacking FoV and other things  No way to search for servers via Ping  Tutorial is awful, and leaves a lot unexplained. (it gets explained later when you unlock more classes, but stuff like weapon melee, sliding, and other basic mechanics should be explained in the FIRST tutorial not later)   Suffers from the same thing that BF4 does where some icons like revive and where the bomb is are just WAY too big.   Pay2win in the sense that you can buy objectively superior gear, however you do have to work to unlock it so it's pretty  balanced at first.  NEWB CHANNELS ARE NOT RANK CAPPED!!!! This results in experienced players coming in and making the game extremely unfun for new players.    Overall the game's cons out weigh the pros so I have to unrecommend, however it is worth a shot right now since as mentioned it's not a big download and as of now since everyone is new it's pretty balanced, however I don't see this game having a long life span unless they fix the hit detection and server searching. It is still in beta so I can hope for sever improvements (it happened in BF4 8 MONTHS after release, so there's definitely hope!)

TL:DR - If you're a selfish ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you'll like this game. If you're one who likes team-work and a decent, fair, balanced fight you won't. Servers mean connections can be terrible.   Wanting a new FPS multiplayer I checked this out. It's fast paced and there's variety amongst classes and some great ideas, like co op climbing up high walls like you see in military vids. You give your team mate a bunk up then he helps you up, it's a great touch as is the baseball type slide feature. It's also got some ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ ideas like having to pay to fix your rifle and gear which takes half your money that you earn each round, which is also pitiful. More annoyingly, you can't search for a server close to you, it just gives you a slot so connections are widely variable which means lag is a massive issue. I've had my end give me a kill then his end catches up and say that no, I actually died. You can't play like that. Your shots just go through people because they have already ♥♥♥♥ing moved and the connection hasn't caught up.  Also one plays to the classes. Medics don't revive (although the defib in this game is the worst designed feature I've seen) and riflemen never resupply. Every round I've played people are in it for themselves, they don't give a flying ♥♥♥♥ about you or the team. There are hackers everywhere and no one cares. I will never understand that mentality. I'll probably put a few more hours into it, because I haven't found a good FPS yet that I can just play a quick round or two whenever I want but I know I'll get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off with the community here very quickly. So I can't recommend this game even though the game itslef is good, it's the community that ♥♥♥♥ it up and my search for a decent FPS continues. Also, ♥♥♥♥ EA.

After finally getting into a lobby, we failed the first mission twice. by now everyone left but me, then some pro player joined, and it became obvious he just wanted to show off and feel superior to us noobs. And we lost again.  --------------------------------------------------- Here is a list of misc. points I have about this game:  -Holy Pay-To-Win.  -Every item (weapon, armor, whatever) I got my hands on was something I could only have for a couple of hours, then the game takes it away. This game was played on Alienware's Alpha, tested on 50' HDMI HIDEF Television and 21' HDMI Hidef Monitor.   Overall the game is good. Pros: Coop is sound. Customization is okay. Coop is okay. Cons: Versus matchmaking is unbalanced. Shooting gets boring and even with strong fps and mbs the bullets just don't seem to kill anyone who has high level armor (p2w issue). Throwing grenades function is bad but the grenades are surprisingly lethal and realistic (blows up even after death if pin is pulled). Character speed is about 1.5x faster than reality (so about .5x faster than cod). Medic is the most powerful and interesting aspect to this game. As there are no finishing 'downed' enemies. So anyone who has been downed can be revived by a medic (within 20 seconds of falling) an unlimited # of times. So yeah hands down medic is the coolest part about this shooter. Loading times are a little slow because you have to wait for everyone to load the map (like DOTA2 not CSGO), however the matches start extremely quickly (2.5 seconds after spawn) so you don't have to wait an eternity wondering if player 5 is going to spawn. Overall I'd give Warface a thumbs up but rate it 6/10. If you want MORE pay to win action and customization go play Tom Clancy. If you'd rather have reliable weapons and positive matchmaking. I'd suggest Counter Strike: Global Offensive as an alternative to this game. However, If you want none of those things and just prefer some light FPS matchmaking, difficult coop missions, or some moderate customization & P2W, I'd recommend this game.

The actual gameplay is decently fun and has a pretty nice reliance on teamwork. The game isn't F2P in any sense: everything can be baught with in-game currency for fairly cheap and timed drops are plentiful. However, the map design really ruins it all.  A breakdown first:  * Decent graphics (definitely dated though). Sound definitely needs work, in my opinion. Not quite sure what it is, but the entire game seems to have a 'plastic toy' feel to it, you know? Dinky guns, dinky finishes.  * Team-based gameplay. You need medics to heal and revive soldiers. You need engineers to resupply armor plating. Snipers do the dirty deeds from afar and the assault provides the ammo. You'll need at least the medic and assault to survive. Snipers are almost necessary for some targets, but engineers are fairly useless. You can help each other climb up ledges too which is a... thing... I guess? Personally never saw anyone actually do it.  * Nice community - I'm sure most of them have learned to deal with the negatives, but I never heard much complaining. Ever time I joined a co-op game they're try to add me as a friend.  * F2P model is just right. The premium currency can be earned in-game by leveling up and completely some fairly nasty wagers (in goes in-game. If you win, out comes premium). The only items that are really blocked off to that premium currency are a few aesthetics and a couple decent weapons (they're in no way overpowered though). In-game currency can be used to buy items, and you can rent them cheaper to try them out.   * Might I add the shop's method of comparing different weapons is so easy. I dig it. However, armors not so much. They barely say what they do, don't use a consistent format, and honestly I only have a vague idea which of 'better protection' or 'good protection' is more significant.  * Co-op missions are fairly fun and change daily. The varied difficulty is nice and the insane missions actually being insane really helps. Revive coins definitely show the F2P side, though.  * Controls work just fine.  But the damn maps.  One game of Storm, the enemy was attacking us. We were pushing pretty hard so pushed forward literally 2 corners. About 30 feet from the cap point (which was only about 10 from our spawn) and... their spawn was a tiny room. The rest of the game was just spawn killing the same two guys (as the rest of the team left as soon as the balance of power showed) over and over again. It was literally impossible for them to ever recover.  Fine, maybe it's just that map. I jump into a game of breach (1 spawn, 1 sided capture the flag). The first round we lost fair and square. But in the second round we take it slower, check our corners and within 40 seconds we all die... from behind. Third round... within 15 seconds an enemy had rounded the corner and killed us all. Just to make sure I wasn't insane, I ran out as fast as I could on the fourth and, sure enough, they spawned about 30 feet from us - with a clear home-field advantage. I couldn't imagine a way we could come out of it.  Like I said, the game itself is fun and the F2P aspect is just right. But those maps, my friends, they make the download not worth it.
