I write this from the perspective of someone who has come to desire FPS games to grant mobility, reward heroism, emphasize cooperation and unity, yet still allow independence.  I won't go out and blatantly say Warface violates all of these, but it leaves much to be desired compared to bigger hit titles (which sure, cost more but comparing a bought game to a F2P isn't the best idea to begin with). Warface is a game that tries hard to emphasize teamwork...so hard that incompetence will easily ruin the game faster than a lag-related glitch any day. Ammunition is often limited, enemies somewhat difficult to kill when engaged in the wrong circumstances, heroics frequently resulting in death, new players and slow learners easily discouraged by deadly mistakes, and solo play virtually impossible. Progression leading to new, more desirable weapons is excruciatingly slow and as of the moment, buying too much permanent equipment often results in repair costs that actually end up more taxing than mission payout rewards, forcing you to tackle higher difficulty sessions (and risk mission failure to wrack up repair costs even further).  There is a rather interesting class system set in play; you enter roles that have the added ability to replenish ammunition, recover health and revive friendlies, restore body armor, and engage enemies from long range. Unfortunately, the roles have a fairly severe lack of balance and reason (Snipers have no inherent special ability, medics are restricted to shotguns, which forces them to the frontline and face direct fire) and players are rewarded very little for fulfilling their roles when compared to enemy kills in general. I personally don't mind finding myself on the bottom of the score leaderboards when I know I singlehandedly kept the team alive as a medic, but it's discouraging enough to other players to the point that they'd rather pick up a rifle and commit to the spray&pray approach instead.  Also, jumping is pretty much worthless. Expect yourself rooted to the ground.  To wrap it up, Warface is a Crytek F2P approach to Team Co-Op/PvP modern warfare. To get far in this game, you have to pay either alot of cash or alot of devotion (of which I no longer am motivated to spend either). If you're a fan of Co-Op repetitive shooters where the odds are often stacked against you, this will be worth considering. If you have a hero complex, hate shooters, or have come to expect shooting games to be more fast-paced (Titanfall, CoD, BF, TF2), you may wish to consider putting this back on the shelf and moving on.

This game is dominated by South Americans and other various poor people with ♥♥♥♥ connections. The movement is clunky and the unlocking model is slow as all hell. The gunplay isn't good enough to make me forget how heavy and akward the movement is. See those videos on the store page? imagine the game like that, but devoid of any actual action, speed, or nice graphical effects. Play something else.

Considering Crytek's repertoire, Warface unfortunately delivers suprisingly bland graphics on par with games made six years ago, incredibly unimaginative gameplay, and an anti-player business model.  Pay-to-win influence is inescapable and prevalent in every facet of the game, even to the point where you can purchase (with real, actual money) the capability to respawn in-place without a medic.  The gameplay itself is of the tired and old team shooter genre, with no unique game mechanics or new ideas.  I'd wager that someone in a Crytek board meeting said aloud 'I've got an idea. Counterstrike, Battlefield, and Call of Duty make a lot of money. Lets take all the worst aspects of these games and put them into our own, with delicious micro-transaction frosting on top! Brilliant!'  The final nail in this game's coffin is the inability to configure field of view and the perpetual lag that permeates every server.

You could say it's 'pay to progress faster' but honestly this game is very pay to win (imo). When I first started playing I asked 'why isn't this game HUGE?' well now I know why, I've played a total of 22 hours on my new account and I currently just uninstalled the game. I'm against having any sort of gear system in the first place, I just don't see how you can balance that other then giving everyone the gear for free and allowing them to change at any time. The only reason I would called this game 'pay to win' is because of the gear system. After I hit LVL 13 crytek (the devs) gives you a bunch of guns and the Warlord armor (the best armor) for 7 days. I have done very well in this game since getting the armor and guns and was able to maintain my 2.5 KD(I mainly play shooters). I currently lost my 7 day armor and guns and now I can tell a huge difference! I die 10x faster than before. You also notice when someone is using the Warlord Armor because they take 10x more bullets than someone without it. The gear can be bought by just playing the game but to by the Warlord set for EVERY class it would take LOADS of grinding or of course you could throw some real cash at it and get the gear instantly. Some people won't mind this system, but play vs someone who has Warload Armor and you will notice how annoying it is, you could seriously shoot first, shoot more with both of you having the same gun and they still tank it and kill you. This won't be a problem for some but you are either grinding your ♥♥♥ off to compete or throwing some real life cash at the game. Also the really good guns are behind crates you can buy with cash you earn but the odds of getting them are really slim. They have the auction house were people can buy the guns with cash instead of going through the crates. This game in my eyes is P2W, such a good game doing the shop and gear all wrong.  Besides those few issues the game is REALLY fun, very solid free to play shooter. If the shop and gear system wasn't so annoying this game would be easily one of the best free to play shooters on the market.  6/10

The servers are hosted by the players, and half the time you get an unresponsive host who won't even start the game. Server selection is very thin and I only see it getting worse once people uninstall this pile.  Avoid at all costs, if you want a free to play shooter, Blacklight Retribution beats this in all aspects.

This game was so promising, it was so very entertaining. I think it's definitely within the top 5 free to play FPS games out there to date..    BUT  ____________________________________________ This game disappointed me so much. It was extremely fun, addictive, and generally just everything I wanted in a FPS game.. until I got to rank 8ish and I got the fabled 'You are too high level to play in this channel' message. It moved me from 'Beginner's Channel' to 'Professional Players Channel'. I have 10 hours in the game, and it's considering me a professional? 'Whatever, I'll try this. It's just a title for non-beginners I guess.' Is my first thought. I join a match and in the loading screen everyone's name is decorated with cool banners and icons, 'No biggy, they've just been playing awhile.'   Not even 2 minutes into the game we're spawn-locked in our beginning building, actually having to run for cover the minute we spawn because of snipers head-glitching in positions where their forehead it seemed was some Medusa-spawn death machine firing bullets. Don't get me wrong, in the first 7 ranks or so there were times we got spawn camped just due to general lack of skill on my team, but the real ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is when I actually started successfully getting out of the base to try on some offense. On 8 or 9 different occasions I hit a full-frontal headshot with my shotgun and their fancy pay-to-win armor blocked all the damage. I actually hit one guy straight in his skullcap, and again in his body from up close and didn't do half his health in damage, whilst him and his fancy pistol, yes pistol, were one-shotting me even with the brand new armor the game gave me for leveling up. This game is so pay-to-win it's hilarious.  I tried out the sniper, got a few well-aimed headshots that hit hard, but again, not even half their health. (the game indicates the damage you've done on your screen via a large transparent hitmarker).. This game had so much potential, I was absolutely hooked until this point. Totally lost in it. I had so much fun but in one single game it became unplayable.   ____________________________________________________________ TL;DR:  ***********This game is fun until rank 8 where the 'pay-to-win' players are unleashed upon you full-force. Be prepared to have to headshot somebody 3 times with a sniper rifle or a shotgun whilst avoiding getting 1-shot by a glock.*************

Show me your warface!   -_-  I can't believe I'm actually not recommending a free game. It's free! I mean, I recommend the game to anyone who wants a couple entertaining hours. This is a one-night stand with a lifeless doll, nothing more.  First off, I pay to win ('pay to support the devs'). Always. This is the FIRST free-to-play game I've played in which I've put down NO money whatsoever.  There's a way to do pay-to-win so that it's fun, and pay-to-win works better in a co-op-based game. In order for pay-to-win to work, however, the game needs to have a fun progression system. You can pay to BYPASS it, but it's there all the same. It's sort of like the unspoken ethic of free-to-play: reward those who pay, but don't punish those who don't. The system is only tolerable if the non-paying route is fun as well. Unfortunately, progression in Warface has been tragically undercut.  Warface has cynically scrapped a feeling of progression by limiting you to a few managable missions at a time. You'll play the 2 or 3 brief missions you can manage, then come up against missions which are too difficult for your level of loot. You're quickly left with a choice: keep replaying the same couple of missions to grind out money and unlocks (which come SO slowly) or pay to play that 4th mission. Their goal is that in any one play session, you'll get bored of easy missions and hungrily eye that 3rd or 4th mission. Seriously: they seem to think the key to getting your money is by making you bored.   I played it two nights in a row, and both times I reached a point where I had memorized enemy spawns on easy and regular missions. Seriously.   Perhaps the most disgusting thing about Warface is the temporary loot. You'll earn loot which disappears after 24 hours, whose only purpose -- I can assume -- is to create a feeling of loss. 'Nooo! Now I have crappier gloves, and I'll have to pay in order to be as good as I was.' It's as if the developers know the game doesn't inspire people in the least, so they've turned to manipulating base emotions in order to get a buck.   I always support free to play games I dabble in, but not this one. It's too cynical, too needy, and not nearly enough fun. The game's life and character begins and ends with its name.

Ok, for reference, I have played and owned Crysis 1, warhead, farcry 1 and crysis 2- all crytek related games.  Ok so, this game plays like a mod of the 'non suit' human players in the MP versions of all crytek's FPS games. Movement is slow, and the sliding is clumsy- especially when you are looking around while sliding and shooting. Hit registration is poor and sometimes greatly delayed and variable. The levelling up and earning money to buy upgrades is HORRIBLY slow and poor- as bad as some of the worst of the FTP games.  This is particularly distressing as the maps available are not only limited, but poorly designed. The maps have a very unrefined unpolished and amateurish quality to it. This applies especially to the strange notion that some of the maps are consistently all about spawn camping and fighting this as an offensive and defensive custer's last stand.  Except for coop, there is not a lot of room to maximally use the class tools for everyone, since even from months ago, most playing do not see any need or reason to take classes other than assault and sniper. There is a horrrendously poor disadvantage as a medic with the shotgun when facing a team full of equally skilled players using assault or sniper in a one life to live match.  If this game is to take off I have the following things to say: - increase run speed, remove sprint and replace it with a walk function, remove slide or improve its mechanic, add a run to dive to prone, add a lean function. - allow medics and engies to be able to boost health and armor OVER the max by a percentage that varies between classes( sniper<engie<assault<medic). - make larger maps, with real design aspects that allow for need and utilization of the classes. If there are cqc situations, why the hell do we need a combat medic who should be healing the team running around charging the enemy? - Also, make better objectives, be original. Stop making the next new COD. - make it worth spending time trying to level up and allow a pickup dropped gun, regardless of class- just make an acc. penalty for it or such (so a medic cant become an instant super sniper). - reduce stupid spamming paid for items that destroy fun in public matches (ftp model fail). - Id happily donate 50 bucks flat out for a full MP only game if it was solid and not interested in fleecing players.  The plus is that it looks and moves very nicely, although slow. Coop is pretty fun but very standard and much of the maps are simple corridor maps. After a few playthroughs, the gimmick is gone.  Conclusion: poor replay value, player base will drop off sharply within the week.  **btw forgot to add, says 2.2 hrs in steam, I played it a bunch directly before the Steam release.

Well, let's see:  Absolute toxic community: I only played 'PVE' and sometimes I just wanted to thrash my living room: As long as you don't play with friends, noone will listen or advise any kind of tactics. Just run in, get killed and call you out if you don't rush to them and rez them asap (Even if it means to get killed, too). Or you get downed and signal your medic to rez you and he just runs headlong into the thickest throng of enemies and gets instantly mauled. Ah, good times...  Repetitive and boring gameplay: Well, you have four classes, Rifleman, Sniper, Medic and Engineer. Three of those four classes have an actual role in this game, the sniper is just.. I don't know, useless. Why? Because all maps are narrow, small and absolutely not suited for long-range-sniping. Plus all classes have a skill, needed if playing team-based. Except the sniper. Medics can rez, Riflemen can give you ammo and Engineers restore your armor. Snipers just.. No, the don't have any of this.. The 'missions' are all the same: get to the evac-point, slaughter as many bad guys as you can and extract. So, yeah, it's like CoD with bad graphics and no story at all (well, not that CoD's storys are THAT awesome...)  Pure grind: I remember when Cryteks CEO said, that after Warface no AAA-Game could survive without beeing F2P. Well, more P2W. The game is free, don't get me wrong, but the best equipment can only be bought with premium-coins, which, as usual, cost real money. You can get most of the stuff by playing missions, but the progress is so slow, you could well be in your 80'ies before you even get to the good stuff. So, did Crytek stay true to their CEO's words? Nope, not even close..   Would I recommend this game? If you have a godlike-tolerance for curse-words, grinding the grind till it grinds and have absolutely no interest in any kind of story aside from some words at the start of your mission, then yes, by all means, play this game!  If those points don't appeal to your liking, then don't. Play Solitair or Minesweeper..

Overall, this game is mediocre at best. Co-op can be fun if you get a decent team. Versus is fun until you hit level 10.  First, the Co-op. The long load times before a game can take up to a minute. Since there are appearently few servers, expect to be playing with gamers from South America. Lag has been a huge issue as far as I've seen. Most players from my random glancing are lucky to get 3 or so bars. The overall map designs on Co-op are fun and on anything other than 'Hardcore' difficulty, it's typically a race among players to get to the finish. You will occassionally run into team-work oriented players who will play as the role suggests, but more often than not you will be relying on the scattered checkpoints to refill health and armor as well as ammunition. 'Hardcore' difficulty only ramps up enemy health and gives them an absurd boost to damage. An enemy NPC who would otherwise be a speedbump can now engage at rifle distance with a shotgun and mow down half your team.  For versus, the game feels inspired by Call of duty and Battlefield, and does neither well. Lag is even more of a problem here, and it is common to get shot through walls or containers. The game pits you with rank 1-10 initially, and paying for boxes will net you a nice advantage weapon wise. I don't suggest trying to get any of the permanent items from the boxes, since I have yet to see anyone with one in game, and you will be wasting your money for 'rentals.' After you hit rank 10, you forced to go to 'Experienced Players' or 'Professional Players' channels. Not that there is much of a choice, because I have yet to see any more than 1 channel at 50% capacity outside of 'Rookie Players' where a good 90% of players are. This means you get about a dozen games to pick from after rank 10. Since the rank is from 1-70, you will often be out-gunned, and can expect to find yourself in a constant ♥♥♥ whooping due to poor auto-balance implementation.  In the 30 or so hours i've played, I've encountered 4 people blatently hacking/using exploits. The weapon, equipment, and unlocking schemes are randomly based on catagory, so expect to dump some time into one of them before you win the lottery and get to unlock the item you're after.  Overall the game feel like it took a bunch of user feedback from what players want in a modern first person shooter, and hap-hazardly threw them together. The game fails to convey all the controls during the tutorials (Press 'X' to go prone, for example.) and the slide function, while pretty cool, breaks the feel of combat. Not to mention to even stand a chance in a one on one fire-fight, you have to go prone, and get back up (all while still firing by the way) which is kind of rediculous since if you get knocked down you have to wait for a team-mate to help you up (or wait for your stamina bar to painstakingly slowly recharge).  My suggestion is to avoid this game until they fix lag and hacking issues, then give it a chance to see if it is up your alley when there is a larger community.

After seeing this title make its debue on the internet and playing the Beta a lot of its issues were forgivable such as the lag, and the UI and the underwhelming weapons and the lack of weapons etc etc. You'd just say ''beta is beta'' and move on.  However, now this is a full release title i must say that the transition has yielded little improvement over the beta versions problems. There are still problems with server lag, the UI is still too clunky and non intuitive. There is still a distinct lack of weaponry and the weapons themselves just don't feel right.   Also this title makes a distinct claim over how it uses the Cryengine an incredibly powerful egine known for having incredible graphical fidelity and uses this as a selling feature. (look at the Crysis series, Mech Warrior Online, Archeage (currently in alpha) at a few examples of how beautiful games can be) However in Warface the implimenation of the engine has produced dissapointing results with low res textures in areas and lack luster effects, not what i would have hoped for in a game using the Cryengine.  Then we come to the worst part of all, the pay to win nature of the game. Every upgrade that can be bought from the in game micro transactions store gives a player a heavy advantage over someone who is playing free, and this is just not acceptable in todays market. Granted i respect that games need to make a profit but there are other examples of micro transactions models that don't disadvantage the free player over the player paying a little extra, see Planetside 2 as a prime example of this.  In conclusion warface show's promise, it could be great, it could definatly be a viable alternative to games such as CSGO and other competitive FPS shooters, but not in its current state. Right now i would avoid this title, grab a copy of CSGO and wait to see if the glaring issues are ironed out during the next few months.  Thanks for reading.

This game, all positive merits and criticizims aside, feels like a cash grab. I won't get into the gameplay, as enough other people do, nor the shallow promises made, also already covered.   All i could think of while playing through this, and working my way through the menu, was that some group of executives sat down with reams of market studies and intrest group reports and assembled the most profitable game possible with the least developer input.  There is no way to create any kind of meaningful profile or character. Everything of real value expires, there's no character development or progression. The only thing you can do is pour money into repetitive gameplay, with no meaningful returns.  This has to be the only F2P i hope actually fails, if only to serve as an example to the industry. Please, don't encourage this kind of c2ap, and move on to something better.

First ever Steam review: This game is very fun to play and pretty easy to learn. If you can play COD, you can play Warface. The classes are cool, the slide mechanic adds another dimension to close range firefights, and the TDM maps are pretty fun and balanced for the most part.    However... this game has NO anti-cheat, and the hacking community makes full use of it. In my and my friends who played experiences, every 4th or 5th game would have a player aimbotting, or cross-map wallbanging (literally, you spawn, and die in the spawn area bc you're getting headshot by a guy in the OTHER spawn zone through all of the map's buildings). Also, the game is incredibly buggy, after 1 in every 3 matches or so, your game will crash and freeze your comp so you have to hard shutdown. I had enough of the pervasive bugs when i tried to adjust my mouse sensitivity and my comp froze.   Basically, this game had potential to be a whole lot of casual and/or competitive fun, but in its current state, i strongly advise to stay away, unless you can deal with multiple computer crashes a sitting and frequent and obvious hackers. If they fix these two areas, i will definitely give Warface another chance bc its some of the most fun i've had on a shooter recently, and it's a nice casual break from CS.

Pros: -Runs well: I can play max graphics and get a constant 60 fps on my moderate PC (and remember- this is a Crytek game) -Fun twitch shooting. If that's what you want, that's what you get. -It's free, so you can try it out and it won't cost you a dime. If you don't like it, then you can just uninstall it.  -Linear progression system is both a positive and a negative- you can't really branch out and choose whatever you want next, you just have a few paths to choose from. It also means that you get things one at a time, and the process can be kinda slow sometimes. However, the streamlined nature of this means that you will always have a clear goal in mind, and you don't get confused about what to do next. Just go shoot more things so you can get whatever shiny new doodad is up next.  Cons: -The game modes are fun, but they're nothing new. -The map design is, while generally good, pretty boring. None of it is inspired (which is something that can be said about the game as a whole). Also, many of the maps are way too small for the number of players they allow, and so the matches can get pretty messy. -While the graphics are good, the aesthetics are bland. It will not wow you with it's looks. Also, the same re-used themes for maps show up again and again- suburban neighborhood with buses blocking the road, cargo docks, and war-torn middle eastern cities. Again- uninspired. -The game claims that it's largely focused on teamplay, and that really isn't true. Certain classes have different abilities that can help your teammates, but people rarely use them. Sure, there are places that can only be accessed if you bring a partner, but those are really only used at the beginning of rounds when everbody moves out at once. Otherwise, it's simply a limit on the places you can easily traverse. -You could easily make an argument that shotguns are overpowered.  Overall: Despite all of the problems with it, I did had fun with this game- for a little while. It gets boring quick, and there are far better games out there. If you need something free to scratch your CoD Clone itch, then this is it- but it isn't really anything more than that.  Final score: 4.5/10. Would only reccomend to a few people.

The production quality of the game seems to be relatively high. The highest I've seen from any free-to-play game. The Co-op portion of the game is relatively dull, at least for the first 4 missions, and most of the people you queue in with are complete mongoloids. I had a guy who didn't even shoot anything the entire game. At least he gave me ammo. That-a-boy, just hand me that box thingy with bullets drawn on the side. Good boy. Now don't get shot :)  The multiplayer aspect of the game could be good if it wasn't riddled in grenades and other things that go boom. I didn't notice anything that seemed pay-to-win. The defaults weapons are actually really good. I spent most of the time as a sniper which was definitely viable. I managed to unlock the first bolt action after a few Coop missions and took it into PvP. I was 1 shotting people at close ranges and it wasn't very hard to hit people in the head. The hitbox is pretty massive.  Overall, the game just felt meh. Not too many pay-to-win elements but the game was definitely ruined by grenade spaming. If you are looking for a high production quality (for a F2P game) FPS and don't have any money to spend, and you love COD or any other grenade spaming, run and gun, style of game and you don't want anything tactical or team oriented, then definitely check this game out!

You may disagree with me or not, but this game is plain old garbage. Sure you do, as some people said, get bored of this game as time passes by.  Rage aswell! Wonder why? Here's some reasons! :  >Netcode is plain old WW1 like. Hits don't register and nades don't do damage either >Anti-Cheat systems (if there even are any) do not do anything. They are just decorations! >Community reports don't mean jack ♥♥♥♥ to the developers or any staff involved in this game >Baddly balanced teams >Votekicking doesn't mean anything to the devs. They put it in, coded in a way in wich you can only use it to kick your team not the opposing one. Then its pretty much your happy round of karma.'  >Outfits' stats don't help you. They are there for decoration. ( I bought 'Knockdown Gloves' with the description saying: 'Guarranteed knockdown on enemies when hit with the butt of your gun.' That description is a lie. Don't ever trust it. >Weapon stats. -First note, this is not Pay 2 Win- This game is pretty garbarge, unless you like co-op. What do I like about this game? The co-op. Thats it. And its pretty similar to survival from CoD. And in my opinion this game is basically CoD: Ghosts, only with worse graphics and debatably worse maps.  Now lets talk about the maps. They are smaller versions of cod ghosts maps. So basically its like combining the chaos of Nuketown and adding the camping of CoD Ghosts. Everyone camps. Thats how people get high scores basically. Also there is another mechanic that is in this game. Sliding. Now sliding is incredibly op, and you can take down any player with sliding and maybe proning.  Now lets talk about the guns. For one, the hit detection is AWFUL. Sometimes it will take 2 seconds for bullets to register. The guns also do very low damage (except for snipers and a couple rifles rifle). This can be very very annoying if you are running engineer with the starter SMG, (by the way, there are 4 classes. Sniper, Medic, Engineer, and Rifleman, which I will get to later) then its really annoying because it has lots of recoil, (more than in almost any game i've played) and takes around 10 bullets to kill with a 30 bullet magazine. Not to mention the guns aren't very accurate. So basically with the starter SMG you can only get about 1 maybe 2 kills with it.  The Sniping. Its pretty bad, considering that it wavers really weirdly and its uncontrollable. It just takes to long to hit someone.  Explosives: the grenades have range even more than CoD4, and they're pretty dang OP. The claymores are more overpowered than in cod, so take it or leave it as you wish Now lets talk about classes. Like I mentioned before there are 4 classes. The sniper is pretty straightforward. A 1-2 shot knife (there is a right and left click attack for the knife), a grenade, and of course, a sniper. Every class has a grenade, and the Rifleman is I believe to be the only class without knife. The Engineer has an SMG, a claymore, and grenade. The starting smg is pretty horrible (like I mentioned before) with the bad hitreg, high recoil, and low damage, and he also can restore armor. Later SMG's are really OP and do high dmg with better mags. The Rifleman is a pretty straightforward class. He comes with an LMG, a grenade, and a pistol (every class comes with a pistol). The medic can heal people (including yourself) and revive people. The medic comes with a shotgun, and is incredibly OP with sliding.  The Health system. Its the same as Counter-Strike, with armor and non-regening health. Nothing more to be said. Ranking system- pretty crap, considering that after Lvl 13 you get matched with Lvl 80s, who slide and camp their asses off. I simply cannot recommend this game. Cons: -Awful Hitreg -Unbalanced damage -Multiplayer is a campfest -Sliding is overpowered -Maps are unstrategic -Bad ranking system Pros: -Non P2W -Co-Op can be fun

50 hours in, I am not having a good time.  I have been playing PVE co-op, and it is incredibly frustrating. You will run into one of two scenarios: 1: You end up with one or more obvious hackers on your team who will run around headshotting everything they see. You'll barely be able to get any kills yourself, let alone accomplish any of the mission's challenge objectives (such as accumulating knife headshots or grenade multikills). Normally, I would consider this frustrating and bad enough on its own, if not for the following scenario which happens more often. 2: You end up with people on your team whom you'll swear are mentally defective, under the influence of narcotics, or both. You know the type: The ones who think it's hilarious to run around in the spawn knifing their teammates or wasting all their ammo shooting the inside of the helicopter, then decide the best strategy is to charge straight towards the enemy and attempt to defeat them by bludgeoning them with their own face. Then, when they inevitably die, they scream insults at you, call you a noob, yell things like GOGOGOGOGOGOGOGOGOGO, or quit, leaving you to try to complete the mission with only one or two people, far less than the mission is clearly designed for. These people actually make me glad to be paired up with cheaters, because those runs are about the only ones you actually successfully complete.  Being paired with players who are both not cheating and not intolerable idiots is a fairly rare occasion.  This latter case wouldn't be so bad (after all, nearly every fps suffers from this to some degree) except that this is an MMOFPS with item rental and repair mechanics. And so not only are they wasting your time, they actually make you lose progression once you start to use weapons and armor that need to be repaired, which defeats the purpose of trying to get those items in the first place. Why would you spend hours trying to unlock cool gear just to have it become a tax upon your further attempts to acquire more cool gear? What's worse, I suspect that if you actually played long enough to get a full set of high-end equipment, it would not be sustainable. Your repair costs would be so high that you would be taking a loss on every match even if you won. Wtf?  Because of this repair mechanic and the awful community I really can't recommend this game to anyone.

This game is ruined by lousy anti-hacking mechanics!   Yes, honourable people don't hack, but they exist everywhere. But I havn't seen so many hackers in the other F2P shooters I played (TF2, Planetside 2, Dirty Bomb).  Crytek, please adjust your game: 1. Change the vote kick system, so everyone can vote (not just the people in the team of the hacker). 2. Adjust your system to detect hacking: most hackers have a very bad hit ratio, although they shoot and kill even on minimal sight. They must fire at random in between.  Finally please change the matchmaking system, so uneven teams are split automatically during games (like in TF2).  Until those issues are fixed, this game isn't fun.

Restarted and played to around the same spot, then disconnected. Rebooted the computer, fired it back up, played the co-op again and made it to the final spot before finishing the match....disconnected. Tried one more time the next day but same thing.  Before everyone gets on me for not doing the hours of tweaking here, changing router settings there, and so on. If I want to play a game and it's good, I shouldn't have to do an hour a prep time to make their game work. From the other negative comments I have seen, a lot point towards the poor NA servers.  On a positive note, the matches that I played (although never got to finish), I really enjoyed it. I wish there was a neutral setting instead of good/bad but I cannot recommend at this time.

Review on Warface:  Start of P2w no doubt i played from beginner to the proffesionel channel ( it's so new players won't get rekt by older )  anyway in the beginner 1 shot to the head with nearly any gun was a one shot, it was fun and everyone pretty much had a chance but due to me being overall better i fast ranked up ( k/d 1.9 ) and then i realized how bad this game was.  First guns, i realized that the guns i had was actually terrible and dealt no damage ( this isn't exactly the guns fault thougth ) i realized that there was armor who could give you benefits, example a armor can give you 50% more health and every bullet you put into the guy with vest was reduced by 20 dmg.  there also exist helms that reduces damage from headshots suddenly i need put 3-5 bullets into my enemies in order for them to actually die. i got so annoyed i even changed to a shotgun and went up close and shot a person straight into the chest, realizing he only took 40% damage and obviously was able to return the damage with a headshot that instant killed me.  There's also reapr cost, in case you should be able to receive all these nice armors,weapons, and so on you will be surprised to see you actually can't use them. why you might think. because there's a durability in this game so even if you earn 400$ a game ( ingame ) then you will realize it might take you 500$ to repair you armor so what you have achieved in the game is eventually actually just a waste because after maybe 50 games you need to repair your armor and you won't even be able to do that!   and even if you could you also need money to get new guns, you get some unlocked thougth clear progress but these guns just isn't as good as the pemium ones in the 'capsule shop' so otherwise you don't mind being a credit warrior and buythe Vip card which gives you Xp/$/vp benefits then you basically can't do alot on the game.  Honestly i liked this game and it's fun as long you keep being in the beginner channel, when you get into the proffesionel channel then it get's bored everyone have better armor, guns than you, and they might need 1 shot to kill you, yet you need 4-5.   Written by a disapointed fan.

In PvP, there are channels dedicated to players based on their level. That sounds great at first, but in reality this is what ruined the game for me. There only two 'levels' of this separation: rank 1-12 and rank 13-79. It's all fun until you reach rank 13... then you are forced to play on the pro channel where everybody has superior weapons and experience. The change of pace is unbeliavable (or everybody had aimbot in my lobbies...)  The basic concept is great, I like the classes, the weapon unlock system, the game is fair to f2p players, etc etc I will give it a shot again sometime, maybe I will get used to it.

I saw this free to play game on the front page today; looked promising! Went through reviews and the reviews seemed great. Those reviews convinced me to download the game and give it a go.  You have to create an account using your email. Okay, that's fine, but then it asks you to sync your steam account anyway. Why not skip the middle man and just sync it to your steam account instead of having to sign up through your email? Not horrible, just a pain...but I did it anyway.  Download the update. Done. Get to the 'character select screen' This is where you choose your face preset. You're given a small handfull of male faces. If you want to have a female face, you have to buy her with real money. (Big mistake in my opinion. ever since Metal gear Online, I REFUSE to give my money to somebody who makes you pay for a female class. Fortunately, not many games are like this, however, this game is one of those games.) After creating my character, I went into the tutorial mode. The tutorial was soooo much fun! Okay, this game has my attention.   After the tutorial, my husband tossed me an invite and a friend's request. I joined his game, got set up and hit ready. He clicks 'start'...nothing happens. He clicks start again...nothing happens. I unready myself and then hit ready again. He clicks start. Nothing happens. Clearly we're missing something, so I google it.   Apparently, this game USED to have it where you could start with just two people but changed it (For whatever dumb ♥♥♥ reason) to where you can only start with a full 4 players. So what looked like a pretty good game is now just a game that my husband and I cannot play because we're forced to have two others. I have friends who would like to play this, but they're not always on at the same time as eachother, making this game a complete waste of my time.   If they should happen to change it back to where you can start with 2 players, I may try this game again. If they change it, I will gladly change my thumbs down to a thumbs up because everything else is good otherwise. If you're a couple or just a person who wants to play with one buddy, avoid this game like the plague. Otherwise, if you have 3 other people to play with at all times, I am guessing this game would be pretty damn fun!
